intro: Strobilanthes tawadana, commonly known as the "Ceylon flame flower," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, vibrant orange to red bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its unique floral display makes it a popular ornamental plant, while its ecological role supports various pollinators. Strobilanthes tawadana is also noted for its ability to thrive in partial shade to full sun conditions.
